name: kind/bug
description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug (i.e. something is not working).

name: kind/dependencies
description: Categorizes pull requests that update a dependency file.

name: kind/documentation
description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to documentation.

name: kind/duplicate
description: Categorizes issue or PR as being a duplicate of another.

name: kind/enhancement
description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a new feature.

name: kind/security
description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to security.

name: good first issue
description: Denotes an issue ready for a new contributor.

name: help wanted
description: Denotes an issue that needs help from a contributor.

name: invalid
description: Not resolvable in any way / This doesn't seem right

name: question
description: Contains a question that needs to be answered / Further information is requested.

name: wontfix
description: This will not be worked on

name: size/XS
description: Denotes a PR that changes 0-9 lines, ignoring generated files.

name: size/S
description: Denotes a PR that changes 10-29 lines, ignoring generated files.

name: size/M
description: Denotes a PR that changes 30-99 lines, ignoring generated files.

name: size/L
description: Denotes a PR that changes 100-499 lines, ignoring generated files.

name: size/XL
description: Denotes a PR that changes 500-999 lines, ignoring generated files.

name: size/XXL
description: Denotes a PR that changes 1000+ lines, ignoring generated files.
